S0227.Q1. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARM?  1. 6 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 6 MONTHS TO 1 YEAR 3. OVER 1 YEAR TO 1.2 YEARS 4. OVER 1.2 YEARS TO 2 YEARS 5. OVER 2 YEARS TO 2 1/2 YEARS 6. OVER 2 1/2 YEARS TO 3 YEARS 7. OVER 3 YEARS TO 3 1/2 YEARS 8. OVER 3 1/2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q2. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL BEFORE ENTERING THE ARM?  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q3. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN OVERSEA? (COUNT FROM THE TIME YOU LEFT THE STATES.)  1. 6 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 6 MONTHS TO A YEAR 3. OVER 1 YEAR TO 1 1/2 YEARS 4. OVER 1 1/2 YEARS TO 2 YEARS 5. OVER 2 YEARS TO 2 1/2 YEARS 6. OVER 2 1/2 YEARS TO 3 YEARS 7. OVER 3 YEARS TO 3 1/2 YEARS 8. OVER 3 1/2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER **************************************************************** P. MOST OF THE QUESTIONS BELOW ARE ABOUT CERTAIN ENTERTAINMENT FACILITIES THE ARMY PROVIDES FOR SOLDIERS IN THE EUROPEAN THEATER. YOUR FRANK AND HONEST ANSWERS TO THESE QUESTIONS WILL HELP THE ARMY PROVIDE THE KIND OF ENTERTAINMENT FACILITIES THAT MEN WANT.

S0227.Q10. HOW EASY IS IT FOR YOU TO FIND A RADIO TO LISTEN TO WHEN YOU HAVE THE TIME AND WANT TO LISTE?  1. VERY EASY 2. FAIRLY EASY 3. PRETTY HARD 4. VERY HARD 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q11. WHEN YOU HAVE TIME AND WANT TO LISTEN, HOW EASY IS IT FOR YOU TO GET TO TURN THE DIALS OF A RADIO TO THE STATIONS YOU YOURSELF WAN?  1. VERY EASY 2. FAIRLY EASY 3. PRETTY HARD 4. VERY HARD 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q12. IF THE POST EXCHANGE SOLD SMALL RADIO SETS AT A REASONABLE PRICE, DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD PROBABLY BUY ONE FOR YOUR OWN US?  1. YES, I THINK I WOULD BUY ONE 2. NO, I DON'T THINK I WOULD BUY ONE 0. NO ANSWER
S0227.Q13. IN GENERAL, HOW INTERESTED ARE YOU IN LISTENING TO NEWS BROADCASTS OVER THE RADI?  1. NOT INTERESTED AT ALL 2. INTERESTED ONLY A LITTLE 3. FAIRLY INTERESTED 4. VERY INTERESTED 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q14. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING TWO WAYS WOULD YOU PREFER THE ARMY RADIO STATIONS TO BROADCAST THE NEW?  1. A NEWS BROADCAST EVERY HOUR: (USUALLY 1 MINUTE SUMMARIES, SOMETIMES 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES) 2. A NEWS BROADCAST 5 OR 6 TIMES A DAY: (A FEW 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES, AND A FEW 15 MINUTE MORE DETAILED BROADCASTS) 3. IT DOESN'T MATTER TO ME 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q15. WHICH OF THESE TWO WAYS WOULD YOU PREFER THE ARMY RADIO STATIONS TO BROADCAST THE NEW?  1. A NEWS BROADCAST 5 OR 6 TIMES A DAY: (A FEW 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES, AND A FEW 15 MINUTE MORE DETAILED BROADCASTS) 2. A NEWS BROADCAST 5 OR 6 TIMES A DAY: (A FEW 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES, ONE OR TWO 15 MINUTE BROADCASTS AND ONE 30 MINUTE BROADCAST) 3. IT DOESN'T MATTER TO ME 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.Q16. NOW, WHICH OF THESE TWO WAYS WOULD YOU PREFER THE ARMY RADIO STATIONS TO BROADCAST THE NEW?  1. A NEWS BROADCAST 5 OR 6 TIMES A DAY: (A FEW 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES, ONE OR TWO 15 MINUTE BROADCASTS AND ONE 30 MINUTE BROADCAST) 2. A NEWS BROADCAST EVERY HOUR: (USUALLY 1 MINUTE SUMMARIES, SOMETIMES 5 MINUTE SUMMARIES) 3. IT DOESN'T MATTER TO ME 0. NO ANSWER

S0227.FORM.  1. B FORM 2. C FORM ****************************PART 2****************************** SPLIT. B FORM. P. IN THE BOXES BELOW ARE THE NAMES AND DESCRIPTIONS OF SEVERAL PROGRAMS WHICH HAVE BEEN BROADCAST OVER THE ARMY RADIO STATIONS IN THE EUROPEAN THEATER. MANY OF THESE PROGRAMS HAVE ALSO BEEN BROADCAST BACK IN THE STATES. THERE ARE TWO QUESTIONS ABOUT EACH PROGRAM, THE FIRST ASKS "HAVE YOU EVER HEARD THIS PROGRAM*" IN ANSWERING THIS, YOU SHOULD ANSWER "YES" IF YOU HAVE EVER HEARD THIS PROGRAM EITHER OVERSEAS OR BACK IN THE STATES. THE SECOND QUESTION IS ALWAYS TO BE ANSWERED WHETHER YOU HAVE EVER HEARD THE PROGRAM OR NOT.
S0227.Q1. HEARD AT HOME: A HALF-HOUR DISCUSSION OF SOME CONTROVERSIAL TOPIC BY A GROUP OF EXPERTS. HAVE YOU EVER HEARD THIS PROGRA?  1. YES 2. NO 3. NOT SURE 0. NO ANSWER 9. INAPPLICABLE (C FORM)

S0227.Q1A. REGARDLESS OF WHETHER OR NOT YOU HAVE HEARD THIS PROGRAM, HOW INTERESTED WOULD YOU BE IN HEARING IT IN THE FUTUR?  1. NOT AT ALL INTERESTED 2. A LITTLE INTERESTED 3. FAIRLY INTERESTED 4. VERY MUCH INTERESTED 0. NO ANSWER 9. INAPPLICABLE (C FORM)
